context_chunks: Have a family history of type 2 diabetes.
Family history of type 2 diabetes.
What about type 1 diabetes?
Have a parent or sibling with type 2 diabetes.
Prediabetes is a major risk factor for type 2 diabetes.

About Insulin Resistance and Type 2 Diabetes
KEY POINTS
Insulin resistance leads to prediabetes and type 2 diabetes.
You may have type 1 or type 2 diabetes instead.
Having a parent, brother, or sister with type 2 diabetes.
If you ignore it, your risk for type 2 diabetes goes up.

The best time to prevent type 2 diabetes
is now.
But having a history of gestational diabetes increases your risk for type 2 diabetes.
You can reverse prediabetes to prevent or delay type 2 diabetes.

Having ketones in your urine indicates
you have type 1 diabetes instead of type 2.
Lifestyle changes can stop or slow the development of type 2 diabetes.

Catching prediabetes early can help people prevent or delay type 2 diabetes. Finding out they have type 2 diabetes—and taking action—can
help people prevent or delay serious health complications.

CONTENT SOURCE:
National Center for Chronic Disease Prevention and Health Promotion; Diabetes
8/14/25, 8:37 PM About Insulin Resistance and Type 2 Diabetes | Diabetes | CDC
https://www.cdc.gov/diabetes/about/insulin-resistance-type-2-diabetes.html 2/2

If you already have prediabetes, this is an added risk factor that makes
you more likely to develop type 2 diabetes. You're at risk for both prediabetes and type 2 diabetes if you:
Have overweight or obesity.
Prediabetes puts you at increased risk of developing type 2 diabetes, heart disease, and stroke.

SOURCES
Type 1 diabetes is different from insulin resistance.

Insulin resistance sets the stage for
prediabetes and type 2 diabetes.
